CONSULTING AND SUPPORT :



Our experience in lean manufacturing and industrial organization gives us in-depth knowledge of best practices in the field, as well as current trends and developments (industry4.0, factory of the future, digital continuity, etc.). Our approach favors co-design and co-delivery of assignments with our customers. Through personalized training and support, we encourage internal teams to take ownership of our approach and tools. This enables us to develop skills, ensure the sustainability of our actions, and multiply their effects.



Our consulting missions cover the entire spectrum of industrial organization:


  • - Implementation of lean manufaturing
  • - Productivity improvement
  • - Flow optimization (simulation)
  • - Quality enhancement
  • - Six Sigma projects
  • - Organization of planning, methods, logistics, etc.
  • - MES (Manufacturing Execution System) applications


We intervene :



  • -Upstream of projects, to ensure alignment with strategy: studies, project selection and   structuring, definition of challenges and profitability, resource allocation, governance,   planning, etc.
  • -During implementation: training, change management, co-development, monitoring   and steering, etc.


PROJECT MANAGEMENT



Project management is a critical activity in any company:

• A project often involves significant resources (financial and human).
• It involves major, even strategic issues
• Its objectives, duration and management are very different from the day-to-day operations of the company's internal teams. We help and support organizations with their projects, in two main areas :
• Industrial projects: new equipment, workshops, organizations, logistics or production sites, etc.
• MES (Manufacturing Execution System) projects: assistance with tool selection, IS integration, parameterization, project follow-up, etc.
We can handle all or part of the following areas:

• Project management assistance to management
• Carrying out a simulation to define the investment plan
• Proposal of financing scenarios and advice on financial arrangements
• We offer assistance and support in selecting specialized engineering firms.
• Carrying out economic and financial studies: NPV, IRR and IP as decision-making aids (integrating the results of specific studies).
• Training and project methodology for internal teams (role of PMO: Project Management Office).
• Project monitoring (schedule, budget, compliance with requirements, steering committees, etc.)
• Change management (studies, training, communication, etc.)
• On-site support (site meetings, action monitoring, operational management, etc.)



TRAINING



B&B ISM's aim is to make its customers autonomous in the appropriation, use and development of lean and industrial organization methodologies and tools. To achieve this, we offer several training modules:

• Cycle lean 4.0: this comprehensive cycle, spread over several weeks, aims to give internal teams a coherent, formalized vision of lean and the factory of the future. Two main themes run through this cycle: on the one hand, knowledge of Lean fundamentals for a global and systemic vision, and on the other, knowledge of Industry 4.0 tools for an appropriation of the most recent Smart Manufacturing tools: IoT, MES, digital continuity, etc. It is based on practical company case studies, which serve as application cases.

• Thematic training courses :
      • Synthetic Efficiency Ratio (SER)
      • Kanban and pull flow
      • Timing and pace judgement
      • Predetermined time methods (MOST)
      • Process modeling (BPMN)

      • Qubes or NetSuite software (MES: Manufacturing Execution System)

• Training customized to your needs (topics, duration, etc.)

In addition to our extensive experience in delivering training modules, we use the following tools:

• Alternating theoretical and practical presentations: slides, videos, etc.
• Company games
• Case studies
• Group work
• Feedback from trainees
• Action training
• …
Our modules can be delivered in inter-company or intra-company sessions, for greater flexibility.

SKILLS :

LEAN-MANUFACTURING :

Lean manufacturing, or lean management, is a system derived from the Japanese school of organisation. Applied by many companies around the world, following in the footsteps of Toyota in particular, lean, properly understood, enables sustainable improvements and major transformations within companies.

We can help you lay the foundations for your standards and acquire in-depth knowledge of your organisation (operating methods and times). On this basis, we can then help you build the pillars of your ‘Toyota house’, using continuous improvement cycles (PDCA): just-in-time, automation, visual communication, etc.

The Lean 4.0 training cycle we offer gives you the complete knowledge you need to run a lean project, with the new tools and orientation of Industry 4.0. We also provide our customers with lean manufacturing consultancy services:

• On in-depth projects to implement the lean mindset within the company. Lean is not just a toolbox. It's more of a philosophy, a state of mind, which gradually takes root in the organisation, becoming natural and lasting over time.


• On more specific subjects, to deal with a more specific problem: definition and improvement of operating times, balancing, workstation organisation, TPM, SMED, 5S, etc. B&B ISM publishes and maintains a Lean knowledge base.


INDUSTRIAL-PROJECTS:

The market, regulations and innovations sometimes force us to review our industrial facilities :

• Installation of a new machine
• New warehouse
• Workshop relocation
• New building
• …

An industrial project of this type is critical, both financially and strategically. It cannot be managed in the same way as routine operations, because of its duration, the concentration of resources, change management, relations with subcontractors, and the heterogeneity of the actions to be carried out:

• Preparing, organising and planning the project (issues, resources, responsibilities, schedule, stakeholders, communication, decision-making, steering, etc.)
• Monitor implementation (progress/delays, critical path, site meetings, coordination, change management, links with suppliers, etc.)
• Preparing for production start-up (training, recruitment, change management, action closure, documentation, capitalisation, etc.)

An industrial project is not just a technical project. It often requires action in the field of :

• Safety: during the works, but also during operation, ergonomic impact, etc.
• Finance: profitability, monitoring costs, supplier invoices, etc.
• Marketing: coordination with R&D, the supply chain and sales, to ensure that the industrial project is in phase with market expectations.
• HR: recruitment, training, information for employee representatives, job organisation, etc.
• Strategy: alignment with the company's strategy and policy, and with the initial challenges.
• Regulations: authorisations, permits, regulations, standards, etc.
• Quality: risk/opportunity analysis, product/process impact (FMEA), procedures and operating methods, control plan, etc.
• All other related departments: reorganisation of maintenance, methods, logistics, design office, etc.

We have successfully completed a number of industrial projects of varying sizes. We can help you organise and monitor your own projects, as project manager or batch leader, or upstream, as PMO (Project Management Officer), in order to define the organisation, methods and tools for project management within the company.


SUPPLY-CHAIN :

The supply chain is at the heart of the industrial process. Optimising flows is a major challenge:

• At both organisational and strategic levels: S&OP process, organisation of pull and push flows, planning and launching of production orders, etc.
• But also in the field: information processing, in-process management, implementation of kanbans, operating times, production losses due to bottlenecks, etc.

B&B ISM provides its know-how, tools and experience in these areas. If the project requires it, we can build a dynamic simulation of the flows concerned. We are a distributor and integrator of FlowSim simulation software.

ORGANISATION OF PRODUCTIONTEAMS :

We can help you set up the organisation to move towards autonomous teams. This type of organisation increases employees responsibility and interest in their work, helps them to find the best ways of working and ways of improving, reduces hierarchical levels and improves responsiveness and flexibility.

We work on :

• Taking stock of the current organisation of production teams, their degree of autonomy, the challenges associated with this organisation, etc.
• The road map for rolling out a new organisation: target, stages, schedule, etc.
• The training required for employees and management.
• Implementing tools and methods: responsibilities within the team, short-interval activities (AIC, or ‘5-minute point’), visual management, etc.

QUALITY /- 6 SIGMA :

The costs associated with quality in the broadest sense are often much higher than those associated with labour productivity, for example. Not only in terms of direct costs (loss of materials, for example), but also indirect costs (customer satisfaction). But it's not always easy to pinpoint the root causes. We can help you find and then deal with these root causes, using different types of methodology:
• Traditional root-cause analysis workgroups (PDCA cycles): quality meetings, brainstorming, Ishikawa, 5M method, 5 Whys, Delphi method, etc.
• Through a 6 sigma project: using the DMAIC methodology, we define the problem and its challenges together, then we use 6 sigma statistical methods to measure the respective impact of the various possible causes.

MES- (Manufacturing Execution System) :

Against a backdrop of increasing digitalisation of the business world (cf. the digital factory, Industry 4.0, digital continuity, etc.), MES (Manufacturing Execution System) tools are becoming more and more prevalent in companies. Providing the link between management systems (ERP, PLM, APS, etc.) and the field (sensors, PLCs, supervision, operator input, etc.), they are at the heart of the connected factory.

Our knowledge of the MES ecosystem (or MOM: Manufacturing Operations Management) enables us to support companies in their MES projects in two main areas:

• Project management assistance: advice on integrating MES into the IS, helping to draw up specifications, choose a solution and manage the implementation project.
• Project management for MES solution integration projects (analysis and functional specifications, training, configuration, start-up support, etc.).
